question_text: Which of the following are characteristics of IPv4 addressing? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: IPv4 supports subnetting for dividing networks
IPv4 addresses are written in hexadecimal
IPv4 provides limited address space compared to IPv6
correct_answer: IPv4 supports subnetting for dividing networks
IPv4 provides limited address space compared to IPv6
explanation: IPv4 is a 32-bit system using decimal format, supports private addressing and subnetting, and has limited address space.
